title: Riot, where are your stories?
body:
Dear Riot,


Whenever I want to read the stories, like those of Taliyah or Jhin and the like, it is quite IMPOSSIBLE to find them on this site. If I wanted to read the stories again after the link in the game/website is gone, I would have to look it up through google to find them on this site again.

Now I know this is not the actual place to post suggestions and more of a place to ask the writers questions, but couldn't you make an extra Button or something where all the lore and stories could be found ON the website?

Sincerely,

Siaanna

replies.body:
HI Siaanna,
I'm sorry, I can't go into things at the moment, but I can say that we recognize the issue and are looking into solutions.

> [{quoted}](name=Jaredan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=64ZkEplo,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-06-10T01:46:07.127+0000)
>
> HI Siaanna,
> I'm sorry, I can't go into things at the moment, but I can say that we recognize the issue and are looking into solutions.

Some suggestions for a quick fix (until the preferred decision can be accomplished):

1.  A real-world timeline of currently written stories in the "Game Info" section (it could be placed between the "Champions and Items" and "Customize Your Summoner" parts.)

2.  Add a section on the website devoted to Lore (between Esports and Boards).

3.  Pin a sticky post with links to all the story sites at the top of the "Story, Art & Sound" boards

Something should be done for the lore, even if it's not the "ideal" solution Riot keeps searching for but never seems able to deliver in a timely manner.

Is there anyway you guys could do a quick fix type thing? Like just a page with a few links to the other story pages... It is a really frustrating problem, that seems super simple to solve... I don't want to be rude but I think this could be one of those situations where Riot over thinks things, when we just want something simple :(. I love the quality product you guys have created, but sometimes you guys take so long with a product, players have forgotten/don't care/are just to frustrated and impatient to be excited about it.

Edit- Thanks for the response though by the way. It's always nice to at least hear about these things from rioters, definitely a +1 in my book.

Aw come on,Jhins complete lore is on his champion page.

Though I agree that the lore should be more accessible(especially through the client,even if its just a link to the full lore)

Champion lore is not all that exists either. What about the Bilgewater Bridge event?
It would be logical that it was somewhere accessible on the site
Nah I agree with the openers overall point,I was just nitpicking that the opener used an example that was actually rather easy to find.

You shouldn't have to go to the wiki to find this though
There should be a lore tab on the main website

You can find them on the League of Legends wiki.
http://www.leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Champion_Name/Background

Thank you, though I was aware of the Wiki, though I would much rather read the stories here. XD
Also, I find it strange that I would have to go to a different site to read the stories when they are actually here, although hidden, on the site :P
